data.question: You're waking up on a typical weekday morning. How do you feel about the day ahead?

options.text: Excited for the opportunities!
Feeling a bit overwhelmed but determined.
Dreading the work ahead.

data.question: You've just arrived at work and are assigned a team project. What's your approach to this task?

options.text: Take charge and lead the team.
Collaborate and share the work equally.
Let someone else take charge.

data.question: During a break, you spot a colleague struggling with a personal issue. What do you do?

options.text: Offer support and listen to them.
Ignore and focus on your own task.
Politely acknowledge and move on.

data.question: After work, you get a gift card worth $100. How do you spend it?

options.text: Buy something you need.
Save it for a rainy day.
Treat yourself to something you want.

data.question: You get invited to an expensive restaurant. How do you respond?

options.text: Go and enjoy the experience.
Politely decline and suggest a cheaper alternative.
Go but keep the spending minimal.

data.question: Later that evening, you’re feeling stressed and overwhelmed. What’s your coping strategy?

options.text: Take a mental health day the next morning.
Power through and ignore the stress.
Talk to your manager about a lighter workload.

data.question: You’ve got a free weekend coming up. What will you do?

options.text: Relax and do nothing.
Explore a new hobby.
Go on a spontaneous trip.

data.question: You’ve been feeling burnt out recently. A new opportunity comes up. How do you react?

options.text: Take the opportunity for more flexibility (remote work).
Decline, preferring the comfort of your current routine.
Negotiate for a hybrid arrangement to balance both.

data.question: A colleague asks you to collaborate on a new product. What’s your next move?

options.text: Take it on and work hard to make it successful.
Negotiate better terms before agreeing.
Decline and focus on your current projects.

data.question: At the end of the week, you reflect on your journey so far. How do you feel?

options.text: Proud of the choices I made and excited for the future.
A bit overwhelmed but satisfied with what I accomplished.
Regretful, wishing I had made different decisions.

data.question: You’ve been invited to a networking event. How do you feel about it?

options.text: Excited to meet new people and make connections.
Reluctant, but decide to go anyway for career growth.
Decline the invitation to relax at home.

data.question: Your friend asks for help with a major life decision. How do you support them?

options.text: Offer practical advice and guidance.
Just listen and let them figure it out on their own.
Give them a loan to help with their decision.

data.question: You’re offered a promotion at work. What do you do?

options.text: Accept it for the new challenges and salary increase.
Decline and keep your current role for work-life balance.
Negotiate for a different work arrangement or benefits.

data.question: You’re at a crossroads in your career. What’s your next move?

options.text: Change careers to pursue your passion.
Stick with your current job for stability.
Take a break and travel to clear your mind.

data.question: You’ve just received a bill that’s a bit more than you expected. What do you do?

options.text: Pay the bill immediately to avoid stress.
Delay payment and review your finances.
Contact the service provider to negotiate a lower charge.

data.question: You’ve been invited to a reunion. How do you prepare for it?

options.text: Go and reconnect with old friends.
Avoid it, preferring to focus on current relationships.
Go, but only to catch up on professional opportunities.

data.question: You’ve started a new fitness regimen. How’s it going so far?

options.text: Feeling great! It's boosting my energy and mood.
Struggling, but determined to keep going.
Giving up, it’s too hard to keep up with.

data.question: A sudden opportunity to work abroad comes your way. What do you do?

options.text: Take it for the adventure and experience.
Decline, preferring the comfort of your home country.
Negotiate terms that provide work-life balance and benefits.

data.question: You’re feeling great after a week of good habits. How do you continue the streak?

options.text: Keep up with a balanced routine of work and rest.
Go on a shopping spree to reward yourself.
Treat yourself to a new hobby to stay motivated.

data.question: A new financial investment opportunity comes up. Do you take it?

options.text: Take the risk, hoping for good returns.
Decline, preferring to stick to safer savings options.
Do thorough research and invest carefully.

data.question: You’re about to make a big decision. How do you approach it?

options.text: Take time to reflect and seek advice.
Go with your gut feeling.
Rush into the decision to get it over with.

data.question: You successfully completed a major milestone in your project. How do you celebrate?

options.text: Throw a party for your team.
Take a day off to relax.
Treat yourself to something special.

data.question: It’s late at night, and you’ve been working on a problem for hours. What do you do?

options.text: Keep working until you solve it.
Sleep and tackle it in the morning.
Ask for help from a colleague or friend.

data.question: You’ve earned some vacation days. How do you spend them?

options.text: Go on an international trip.
Take a staycation to recharge.
Volunteer for a cause you care about.

data.question: You receive an unexpected cash bonus. What do you do?

options.text: Save it for future expenses.
Invest in a side project or stocks.
Spend it on a luxury item.

data.question: Your pet is seeking attention while you’re busy. What do you do?

options.text: Take a break to play with them.
Continue working and ignore them for now.
Ask someone else to care for them temporarily.

data.question: A friend invites you to join a fitness class. What do you do?

options.text: Join and commit to regular sessions.
Try it out but don’t commit.
Decline and stick to your own routine.

data.question: Your friends are hosting a game night. How do you participate?

options.text: Go all in and try to win!
Play casually and have fun.
Skip it to focus on personal tasks.

options.text: Sign up and explore your creativity.

options.text: Sing your heart out.
Cheer for others and enjoy the event.
Avoid it and focus on your hobbies.
